creator: hauser@acm.org
text:
Since large institution's PKIs failed or are dormant, one must expect more
public key certificates be put on personal home-pages irrespective of whether
the serving httpd is ssl-enabled or not.
This because the biggest use of certificates in short and mid-term is likely to
be e-mail (thawte free-mail certificates and self-signed certificate managed
like pgp's "web of trust").

creator: slive@apache.org
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 15235 ***

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
Hmmm... I guess it is not actually a dupe.  Sorry.

But in general, we would place something like this in mime.types.  However,
our policy is not to place x-types in mime.types.  We only use properly
registered types.

from
http://www.isi.edu/in-notes/iana/assignments/media-types/application/
:
the correct mime types fro this are the
application/pkcs... and
application/pkix...
mime types. The Mozilla guys still seem to like the the netscape invented x- mime types more or they did not yet notice that there are officially assigned mime types for all the certs.
creator: maccy2@yahoo.com
fielding@apache.org
text: These types were added to mime.types in r571614.
